intro: Exocarpos clavatus, commonly known as the rough-hair nut or Australian hibiscus, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain small, edible seeds. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in heathlands and open forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in suitable climates.
